#summary Document how developers can download and build this system.
#labels Featured

This document introduces how to build a release of the Hackystat Eclipse sensor from source using Eclipse's plug-in development environment. 

= 1.0 Install required package =

The Hackystat Eclipse Sensor project is organized as a feature of Eclipse. You will need Eclipse to build, debug and run the system. 

|| Package || Version || Remark  || 
|| [http://java.sun.com/ Java]    || 5 or 6    || Eclipse must run on JRE 5 or 6 || 
|| [http://europa-mirror1.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/R-3.2.2-200702121330/index.php Eclipse] || 3.2     || ||
|| [http://code.google.com/p/hackystat-sensorbase-uh/ Sensorbase-uh] || 8.0   || || 
|| [http://code.google.com/p/hackystat-sensor-shell/ Sensorshell] || 8.0  || Update plugin\lib\sensorshell.java5.jar if necessary ||
  

= 2.0 Check out the sources =
Check out the sources from the trunk of the Google Project repository. The URL is:

http://hackystat-sensor-eclipse.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/

The [http://code.google.com/p/hackystat-sensor-eclipse/source Hackystat Eclipse Sensor Source Page] has more instructions

= 3.0 Build a release using PDE =

In the checked out sources, you should see four folders named site, feature, plugin and images. 
|| ./site || Defines the sensor-eclipse-site project project that organizes an update site for users to install the sensor using the *Update Manager* of Eclipse (See [http://code.google.com/p/hackystat-sensor-eclipse/wiki/UserGuide UserGuide]). ||
|| ./feature || Defines the sensor-eclipse-feature project that encapsulate the sensor as an Eclipse feature for ease of use. ||
|| ./plugin || Defines the sensor-eclipse-plugin project that implement the Eclipse sensor for Hacksytat 8. ||
|| ./images || Some screenshots used by [http://code.google.com/p/hackystat-sensor-eclipse/wiki/UserGuide UserGuide] or [http://code.google.com/p/hackystat-sensor-eclipse/wiki/DeveloperGuide DeveloperGuide]. || 

Import three predefined projects into your Eclipse IDE.
